title.narrative: Emergency WASH response to displaced populations, host communities and malnourished child-caregiver pairs in Tillabery and Tahoua regions.

description.narrative: The main objective of this WASH project is to meet the specific safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation needs of men, women, boys and girls affected by the movement of population and malnutrition crisis in Tahoua and Tillabery regions. UNICEF will ensure that 7,000 individuals have access to safe drinking water, through the reinforcement of 5 water points. UNICEF will also construct emergency latrines to serve 8,027 individuals. Some 14,372 individuals will be reached over 7 months.
